isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - FILTER-DRIER

svcprocinfo.para: The filter-drier inlet and outlet lines are part of the filter-drier assembly ( Figure 30).

note.para: If the filter-drier is one of multiple components being replaced in the system, the filter-drier should be one of the last components installed. This reduces the amount of time that the filter-drier desiccant is exposed to atmospheric moisture.

svcprocinfo.para: Depending on the vehicle model/engine combination, replacement of specific A/C refrigerant components may require the removal of nearby assemblies to gain access to the components or related A/C lines. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

note.para: Refer to Figure 29 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
To allow movement of condenser-to-evaporator line (4, Figure 29), remove or loosen hose support clamps and/or strap locks used to secure line at evaporator housing (3).
Disconnect condenser-to-evaporator line (4) from filter-drier inlet line.
Remove screw securing filter-drier inlet line clamp to evaporator housing (3).
Remove T30 Torx head screw from locking plate on top of expansion valve (10).
Remove locking plate from top of expansion valve.
While supporting filter-drier (6), remove two mounting bolts securing filter-drier to evaporator housing.
Remove filter-drier by lifting it free of expansion valve.

If A/C system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings on fittings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: With a new lubricated O-ring on the filter-drier outlet tube, carefully insert tube into expansion valve (10, Figure 29) while securing filter-drier (6) to evaporator housing (3) with two mounting bolts. Tighten to 11.0 to 11.6 N.m (8.1 to 8.5 lbf-ft).
Position locking plate on top of expansion valve and secure with T30 Torx head (M6) screw. Tighten to 9,000 to 10,000 N.mm (80 to 90 lbf-in).
Install screw securing filter-drier inlet tube clamp to evaporator housing.
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect condenser-to-evaporator line (4) to filter drier inlet tube. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
Secure condenser-to-evaporator line at evaporator housing using hose support clamps and/or strap locks removed earlier.

Recharge A/C system. Refer to CHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
Install cab cowl tray, if previously raised or removed.
